question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
The polar coordinates of points $A,$ $B,$ and $C$ are $(2,70^\circ),$ $(2 \sqrt{3}, 40^\circ),$ and $(3,10^\circ),$ respectively.  Compute the area of triangle $ABC.$
inference:
The area of a triangle with vertices $(r_1, \theta_1), (r_2, \theta_2),$ and $(r_3, \theta_3)$ is given by

$$\frac{1}{2} \left| \begin{array}{ccc} r_1 & r_1 \cos \theta_1 & r_1 \sin \theta_1 \\\ r_2 & r_2 \cos \theta_2 & r_2 \sin \theta_2 \\\ r_3 & r_3 \cos \theta_3 & r_3 \sin \theta_3 \end{array} \right|.$$

So, the area of triangle $ABC$ is

$$\begin{split} \frac{1}{2} \left| \begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 2 \cos 70^\circ & 2 \sin 70^\circ \\\ 2 \sqrt{3} & 2 \sqrt{3} \cos 40^\circ & 2 \sqrt{3} \sin 40^\circ \\\ 3 & 3 \cos 10^\circ & 3 \sin 10^\circ \end{array} \right| &=\frac{1}{2} \left| \begin{array}{ccc} 2 & -1.932 & 1.902 \\\ 2 \sqrt{3} & 1.539 & 1.307 \\\ 3 & 2.998 & 0.516 \end{array} \right| \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} \left( 2 \left| \begin{array}{cc} 1.539 & 1.307 \\\ 2.998 & 0.516 \end{array} \right| - (-1.932) \left| \begin{array}{cc} 2 \sqrt{3} & 1.307 \\\ 3 & 0.516 \end{array} \right| + 1.902 \left| \begin{array}{cc} 2 \sqrt{3} & 1.539 \\\ 3 & 2.998 \end{array} \right| \right) \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} \left( 2 (0.792) - (-1.932) (1.032) + 1.902 (5.994) \right) \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} (1.584 + 2.002 + 11.389) \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} (14.975) \\\ &=\boxed{7.4875}. \end{split}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{7.4875}.$ I hope it is correct.

question:
The area of a triangle with vertices $(r_1, \theta_1), (r_2, \theta_2),$ and $(r_3, \theta_3)$ is given by

$$\frac{1}{2} \left| \begin{array}{ccc} r_1 & r_1 \cos \theta_1 & r_1 \sin \theta_1 \\\ r_2 & r_2 \cos \theta_2 & r_2 \sin \theta_2 \\\ r_3 & r_3 \cos \theta_3 & r_3 \sin \theta_3 \end{array} \right|.$$

So, the area of triangle $ABC$ is

$$\begin{split} \frac{1}{2} \left| \begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 2 \cos 70^\circ & 2 \sin 70^\circ \\\ 2 \sqrt{3} & 2 \sqrt{3} \cos 40^\circ & 2 \sqrt{3} \sin 40^\circ \\\ 3 & 3 \cos 10^\circ & 3 \sin 10^\circ \end{array} \right| &=\frac{1}{2} \left| \begin{array}{ccc} 2 & -1.932 & 1.902 \\\ 2 \sqrt{3} & 1.539 & 1.307 \\\ 3 & 2.998 & 0.516 \end{array} \right| \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} \left( 2 \left| \begin{array}{cc} 1.539 & 1.307 \\\ 2.998 & 0.516 \end{array} \right| - (-1.932) \left| \begin{array}{cc} 2 \sqrt{3} & 1.307 \\\ 3 & 0.516 \end{array} \right| + 1.902 \left| \begin{array}{cc} 2 \sqrt{3} & 1.539 \\\ 3 & 2.998 \end{array} \right| \right) \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} \left( 2 (0.792) - (-1.932) (1.032) + 1.902 (5.994) \right) \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} (1.584 + 2.002 + 11.389) \\\ &=\frac{1}{2} (14.975) \\\ &=\boxed{7.4875}. \end{split}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{7.4875}.$ I hope it is correct.
